snippet: A big problem with a proposed change in the bankruptcy procedure is its effort to penalize the provider of debtor-in-possession financing if the new financing is used to “overpay” creditors.
abstract: A big problem with a proposed change in the bankruptcy procedure is its effort to penalize the provider of debtor-in-possession financing if the new financing is used to “overpay” creditors.

headline.main: What's Wrong With the Chapter 14 Proposal

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
